items: Start by sitting on a bench with your back straight and your feet flat on the ground.
Hold a barbell with an overhand grip and lift it above your head, keeping your arms straight.
Slowly lower the barbell behind your head, bending your elbows and keeping your upper arms close to your head.
Pause for a moment, then lift the barbell back up to the starting position, straightening your arms.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Targets the triceps muscles, helping to build strength and size in the arms
Improves overall upper body strength and stability
Can be performed with a variety of weights and variations to challenge the muscles in different ways
Helps to improve range of motion and flexibility in the shoulders and elbows
Can be easily modified for individuals with injuries or limitations
